hypothesis_content.title: Cross-Exchange Liquidity Arbitrage During Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes, temporary liquidity imbalances between major exchanges (Binance vs Coinbase vs Kraken) create 2-4% price divergences that converge within 2 hours as arbitrageurs deploy capital.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes have sufficient liquidity for arbitrage execution but lack directional momentum that would overwhelm mean reversion. Market makers allocate capital based on volatility expectations, creating temporary inefficiencies.
entry_conditions: BTC/ETH price divergence between any two major exchanges > 2%
Liquidity depth on cheaper exchange > $5M within 1% of price
No major exchange-specific news/outages in past 2 hours

exit_conditions.take_profit: Divergence closes to < 0.5% OR 1.8% profit captured
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Divergence widens beyond 4% OR regime shifts to STRESS

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Divergences persist >4 hours despite adequate liquidity, indicating structural barriers to arbitrage (withdrawal limits, regulatory friction).
